title: 110_s1923
content: The "Housing Assistance Authorization Act of 2007" prohibits the use of authorized amounts for lobbying purposes. Additionally, assistance is provided to the Housing Assistance Council. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development may provide financial assistance to the Housing Assistance Council for developing the capacity of rural community-based housing organizations. This assistance includes technical support, financial aid for affordable housing projects, and other determined activities. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development may provide financial assistance to the Housing Assistance Council for rural community-based housing organizations. Authorization of appropriations includes $5,000,000 for fiscal year 2008 and $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2009 and 2010. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development may provide financial assistance to the Raza Development Fund. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development may grant funds to the Raza Development Fund for providing assistance to local non-profit organizations in community development and affordable housing projects for low- and moderate-income households, especially in neighborhoods with Hispanic populations. The assistance can be used for site acquisition, development, construction financing, and leveraging capital from private entities. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development may grant funds to the Raza Development Fund for providing assistance to local non-profit organizations in community development and affordable housing projects for low- and moderate-income households, especially in neighborhoods with Hispanic populations. The assistance includes financial support from private institutions, insurance companies, and philanthropic organizations, technical assistance, training, and other activities as determined by the Secretary and the Raza Development Fund. Authorization of appropriations includes $5,000,000 for fiscal year 2008 and $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2009 and 2010. SEC. 5. Assistance for the Housing Partnership Network. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development may grant funds to the Housing Partnership Network to support affordable housing and community facilities for low- and moderate-income households. This assistance can be used for investments, loans, and grants to member nonprofits to leverage private capital for housing projects and to enhance the production capacity of its members. The Housing Partnership Network may receive funds from the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to support affordable housing and community facilities for low- and moderate-income households. The funds can be used for investments, loans, and grants to member nonprofits to leverage private capital for housing projects. Additionally, the Network is authorized to conduct activities determined by the Secretary and manage expenses within specified limits. Authorization of appropriations is set at $5,000,000 for fiscal year 2008 and $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2009 and 2010. The Comptroller General of the United States will audit financial transactions of entities receiving funds under the Act and submit reports to relevant Senate and House committees. Additionally, a study will be conducted on the use of funds appropriated to these entities over the past 10 years. SEC. 7. PERSONS NOT LAWFULLY PRESENT IN THE UNITED STATES. Prohibits the use of funds under this Act for direct housing assistance to individuals not lawfully present in the United States.
